moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. Nc3: Oddly enough, from here it looks like it will be dull.
moves.4... Be7 5. a3 O-O 6. d3 d6 7. Be3 Bg4 8: A half-open file with my king on it.  Promising.
moves.16. dxc4 dxc4 17. Qxd4 Qa5 18. Nd5: I'm looking to set up Bxa3 (either winning back the bishop or threatening mate with Kb1 c3).
and here's where it gets interesting
moves.22... Kh8 23. Rxh7+ Kxh7 24. Qh4+ Kg6 25: He has a draw here (3 move rule) but he decides to go for more.  bad idea.
moves.29. Qf4+ Ke7 30. Qe5+ Kd7 31. bxa3: Taking here gives me initiative.  and his king.  bad combination.
moves.31... Qxa3+ 32. Kb1 c3: perpetual check is his only hope.
moves.33. Qf5+ Kc7 34. Qe5+ Kb6 35. Qd4+ Ka5:
So I castled kingside, and my king eventually found safety on a5.  I made 13 king moves throughout the game, coming from e8 to h1 to a4.

White resigned, because my king's position was SOLID.
